Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears. It enables the buyer to process the document in an appropriate way.

Element.Name: Pre-award catalogue identifier
Element.Description: The identifier that enables referencing of the document instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Catalogue action code
Element.Description: Identifies how a received catalogue should be used against existing catalogue lines sent in previous catalogues, so that no discrepancies occur between the suppliers and customers information. Describes how to treat existing items, not part of the received catalogue and those that are included (unchanged, changed or deleted). Default action is to fully replace the source catalogue.

Element.Name: Catalogue name
Element.Description: A name of the catalogue for general reference.

Element.Name: Catalogue issue date
Element.Description: The date on which the catalogue instance was issued, format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information

Element.Name: Catalogue issue time
Element.Description: The time on which the pre-award catalogue was issued. Time shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: General payment conditions
Element.Description: Textual description of the general payment conditions that apply to all items in the catalogue.

Element.Name: Catalogue version
Element.Description: The version ID of a catalogue.

Element.Name: Pre-award catalogue validity period
Element.Description: The validity period must include both start date and end date, and the start date must be earlier than the end date

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date when the period starts, format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date when the period ends, format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information

Element.Name: Contract reference
Element.Description: A reference to a contract that can be identified.

Element.Name: Contract identifier
Element.Description: Normally not used in pre-award catalogues, but might be used in re-opening of Tender, DPS etc.

Element.Name: Reference number
Element.Description: An identifier that is specified by the buyer and used as a reference number for all documents in the procurement process. It is also known as procurement project identifier, procurement reference number or contract folder identifier.

Element.Name: Provider party
Element.Description: The party that sends the catalogue.

Element.Name: Catalogue provider electronic address identifier
Element.Description: The electronic address of the party that sends the catalogue.

Attribute.Name: Identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification of the identification scheme.

Element.Name: Catalogue provider standard identifier
Element.Description: The standard identifier of the party that sends the catalogue.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for provider party identification

Element.Name: Catalogue provider name
Element.Description: The name of the party that sends the catalogue.Use in absence of, or additon to party identifier

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver
Element.Description: The party to which the catalogue is sent.

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver electronic address identifier
Element.Description: The electronic address of the party to which the catalogue is sent.

Attribute.Name: Identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification of the identification scheme.

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver standard identifier
Element.Description: The standard identifier of the party to which the catalogue is sent.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for receiver party identification

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver name
Element.Description: The name of the party to which the catalogue is sent.

Element.Name: Catalogue supplier
Element.Description: The party that provides the items specified in the catalog, must be used if the supplier is different from the catalogue provider

Element.Name: Catalogue supplier standard identifier
Element.Description: The standard identifier of the party that provides the items specified in the catalogue.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for catalogue supplier party identification

Element.Name: Catalogue supplier name
Element.Description: The party that provides the items specified in the catalogue.

Element.Name: Catalogue Customer
Element.Description: The party who may order from the catalogue, must be used if the customer party is different from the receiver party

Element.Name: Catalogue customer standard identifier
Element.Description: Standard identifier of the party who may order from the catalogue.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier for catalogue customer party identification

Element.Name: Catalogue customer name
Element.Description: Name of the party who may order from the catalogue.

Element.Name: Pre-award catalogue line
Element.Description: Detailed information of an item, price and its composition in a pre-award catalogue.

Element.Name: Pre-award catalogue line identifier
Element.Description: Each line must have an identifier that is unique within the document to make it possible to reference the line. For example, from other documents.

Element.Name: Line action code
Element.Description: Used to instruct the catalogue receier on what action should be taken on the identified line when revising a catalogue. See rule on catalogue version ID. When using Update or Delete codes, the entire Catalogue Line is updated or deleted.

Element.Name: Contract subdivision
Element.Description: A relevant subdivision of the contract a catalogue refers to.

Element.Name: Catalogue line orderable indicator
Element.Description: Indicates whether the catalogue line can be ordered. Allowed values are ´true´ or ´false

Element.Name: Orderable unit
Element.Description: The unit in which the item described in this catalogue line can be ordered. Mandatory if the item is orderable Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Item net quantity
Element.Description: The net quantity of the item that is contained in each consumable unit, excluding any packaging materials.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Order quantity increment
Element.Description: Possible limitation to the number of articles that can be ordered. If the Quantity increment is 6 the article must be ordered in a quantity of 6, 12, 18 etc.

Element.Name: Minimum order quantity
Element.Description: The smallest number of items that can be ordered.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Maximum order quantity
Element.Description: The largest number of items that can be ordered.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Catalogue line warranty information
Element.Description: Warranty information that applies to the catalogue line item.

Element.Name: Handling unit packaging level
Element.Description: The packaging level of the orderable unit used to indicate different pack levels and their relation.

Element.Name: Line validity period
Element.Description: The line validity period must be the same, or within the document validity period, if it exists.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The line validity start date, the date must be the same, or earlier than the delivery end date. Format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The line validity end date, the date must be the same, or later than the delivery start date. Format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: Item comparison
Element.Description: Used for comparing prices for different articles with various quantities. E.g. Price of each liter.

Element.Name: Standardized unit price
Element.Description: Item comparison unit price defining price for a certain quantity.

Attribute.Name: Currency identifier
Attribute.Description: Currency code from ISO 4217

Element.Name: Standard unit quantity
Element.Description: E.g. if consumable units are bottles and each bottle contains 0,333 liters the standard unit quantity is 0,333.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Component related item
Element.Description: Component related items are products that are connected in a product line or a logistics structure, e.g. consumer units and trading units of the same article.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: Indicate the seller's identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Related item quantity
Element.Description: Quantity of a related item

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Required related item
Element.Description: Required related items are products that are bundled and ordered/invoiced together, e.g. bottles and desposits.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: Indicate the seller's identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Related item quantity
Element.Description: Required related item quantity, the quantity of the products bundled with the products on this line.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Complementary related item
Element.Description: Complementary related item is used for items that might be sold together with a product, e.g. disk station to a laptop.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: Indicate the seller's identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Related item quantity
Element.Description: Complementary item quantity, the quantity of the products that might be sold together with the products on this line.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Replacement product
Element.Description: Replacement product is used to identify a product replacing an existing product in the Catalogue.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: Indicate the seller's identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Related item quantity
Element.Description: Replaced item quantity, the quantity of the products replacing the products on this line.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Item Location Quantity
Element.Description: Properties of the item in this catalogue line that are dependent on location and quantity.

Element.Name: Minimum quantity
Element.Description: The minimum quantity that can be ordered to qualify for a specific price.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Maximum quantity
Element.Description: The maximum quantity that can be ordered to qualify for a specific price.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in an address.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The common name of the city, town or village, where the Seller address is located.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: The subdivision of a country.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.

Element.Name: Price
Element.Description: Used to give the item net price as well as conditional price related to a specific location or a quantity, as well as campaign prices.

Element.Name: Item net price
Element.Description: The net price has to be equal with the gross price less the item price discount. The price for the item at the specified locations.

Element.Name: Item price type
Element.Description: The type of the price so that the receiver knows if the price may be changed is indicative. When prices are temporary the validity period for the price should be defined by stating the price validity period.

Element.Name: Orderable unit factor rate
Element.Description: The factor by which the base price unit of an item can be converted to the orderable unit.

Element.Name: Price validity period
Element.Description: The price validity period must be the same, or within the line validity period if it exists

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The price validity period start date, the date must be the same, or ealier than the delivery end date. Format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The price validity period end date, the date must be the same, or later than the delivery start date. Format YYYY-MM-DD. Date shall not include timezone information.

Element.Name: Item description
Element.Description: The Item description allows for describing the item and its features in more detail than the Item name. It is only allowed to send one description element pr. language.

Attribute.Name: Language identifier
Attribute.Description: Language identifier to indicate which language the description is stated in.

Element.Value: This is a rather long item description, often very detailed

Element.Name: Packed Quantity
Element.Description: The number of packed units that are in the orderable unit.

Attribute.Name: Quantity unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit of the quantity Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Packed units
Element.Description: The packaging the item is available inside the orderable unit (next lower level packaging), and which contains the number of the unit described in Packed quantity.

Element.Name: Item name
Element.Description: A name for an item.

Element.Name: Item key words
Element.Description: Used to specify searchable keywords and/or synonyms for the specific item.

Element.Name: Item brand name
Element.Description: Name of the brand of the item to allow economic operators to distinctively describe an item in their catalogue or pre-award catalogue.

Element.Name: Item sellers identifier
Element.Description: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. This element is not mandatory because some companies may not have the identifier yer at the time of issuing the pre-award catalogue.

Element.Name: Manufacturers item identifier
Element.Description: The manufacturer's identifier for the item.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: The standard identifier of the catalogue item.

Attribute.Name: Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier

Element.Name: Item sellers extended identifier
Element.Description: An extended identifier issued by the seller to identify items with specific properties. Used for structured identification of an Item variant.

Element.Name: Attached item specifications
Element.Description: Attachments can be sent on line level in the Catalogue. This can be images or additional descriptions of a product. It is strongly recommended to use external references in the form of URI's for attachments.

Element.Name: Attachment identifier
Element.Description: An identifier that can be used to reference the attached document, such as an unique identifier.

Element.Name: Attachment description code
Element.Description: A functional description of the attachment, expressed as a code.

Element.Name: Document type
Element.Description: A functional description of the attachment.

Element.Name: Attachment description
Element.Description: A short description of the attached document

Element.Name: Attached document
Element.Description: A binary large object containing an attached document. Base 64 encoded.

Attribute.Description: Mime type of the attached document
File name of the attached document

Element.Name: External item specification URI
Element.Description: URI reference to external item information or specifications. E.g. web address

Element.Name: Item origin country
Element.Description: The code identifying the country from which the item originates. Commonly used in cross border trade for statistical and customs purposes.

Element.Name: Transaction conditions code
Element.Description: Coded description of the specific transaction conditions (purchasing, sales, payment) for an item.

Element.Name: Transaction conditions
Element.Description: Textual description of the specific transaction conditions (purchasing, sales, payment) for an item

Element.Name: Hazardous hazard class identifier
Element.Description: Specification of the hazardous nature of an item according to a classification schema.

Element.Name: Hazardous item UNDG code
Element.Description: Specification of the hazardous nature of an item according to the UNDG classification schema.

Element.Name: Classified tax category
Element.Description: VAT information

Element.Name: Item VAT category code
Element.Description: The VAT category for the item

Element.Name: Item VAT rate
Element.Description: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies to the item. A VAT rate of zero percent is applied for calculation purposes even if the item is outside the scope of VAT. Unless specific trade reasons apply such as exemptions.

Element.Name: Additional item property
Element.Description: Additional properties are meant for product properties that cannot be sent in any of the defined elements in PreAward Catalogue. Additional properties consist of the Name of the property and the actual Value.

Element.Name: Item property identifier
Element.Description: A property identifier for the property of the item request.

Element.Name: Item property name
Element.Description: The name of the property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.

Element.Name: Item property classification code
Element.Description: Code for the item property according to a property code system

Element.Name: Item property value
Element.Description: The value of the item property

Element.Name: Item property value quantity
Element.Description: The quantity of the item property.

Attribute.Name: Value quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Property description
Element.Description: Free text description of the property

Element.Name: Manufacturer name
Element.Description: The name of the party that manufactures the item.

Element.Name: Item instance
Element.Description: A trackable, unique instantiation of this item.

Element.Name: Item best before date
Element.Description: The date until when the relevant item qualities will remain at their best. Used to express the best before date of the item or items in the line instance.

Element.Name: Item means of proof
Element.Description: A means of proof according to to Directives 2014/24/EU.

Element.Name: Item means of proof identifier
Element.Description: A unique identifier being unique in a transaction for a Item means of proof.

Element.Name: Item means of proof type
Element.Description: A code specifying the type of the Item means of proof according to Directives 2014/24/EU, e.g., if it a label, test report etc.

Element.Name: Item means of proof name
Element.Description: Name of a item means of proof, e.g., the name of a label.

Element.Name: Item means of proof value
Element.Description: The value according to the Item means of proof that applies to the item.

Element.Name: Item means of proof issuer party
Element.Description: The party issuing the means of proof for the item. E.g., the organisation that issues a label or test reports, etc.

Element.Name: Item means of proof issuer party name
Element.Description: Name of the party issuing the means of proof for the item.

Element.Name: Document reference
Element.Description: This element is bound to two different business terms: Item means of proof reference or Item requirement reference. To indicate the, if the document reference is a reference to an means of proof, use the code Item_means_of_proof_reference. For an Item requirement reference use the code Item_requirement_reference.
Pseudo code indicating the DocumentReference as an Items means of proof reference or an Item requirement reference.

Element.Name: Item means of proof reference or Item requirement reference
Element.Description: Item means of proof reference is reference to an external specification of the provided means of proof. An Item requirement reference is a reference to the corresponding Item requirement given in the corresponding pre-award catalogue request this pre-award catalogue is build on.

Element.Name: Handling unit dimensions
Element.Description: The element is used for describing the various dimensions of the handling unit. The element cbc:AttributeID is used to define which dimension is described by the dimension element. The following mapping applies for the cbc:AttributeID: HT = Handling unit height, LN = Handling unit length, WD = Handling unit width, AAB = Handling unit gross weight, TC = Handling unit minimum/maximum temperature, AAO = Handling unit minimum/maximum storage humidity

Element.Name: Attribute identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the attribute to which the measure applies.

Element.Name: Handling unit height or length or width or gross weight
Element.Description: The dimensions of the handling unit: (1) Handling unit height: The vertical height of the orderable unit. (2) Handling unit length: The horizontal measure of the longer site of the orderable unit. (3) Handling unit width: The horizontal measure of the shorter side of the orderable unit. (4) Handling unit gross weight: The gross weight of the orderable unit including its packaging.

Attribute.Name: Unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Handling unit minimum storage temperature
Element.Description: The minimum dimensions of the handling unit: (1) Handling unit minimum storage temperature: The lower margin of the recommended storage temperature range for the item. (2) Handling unit minimum storage humidity: The lower margin of the recommended storage temperature range for the item.

Attribute.Name: Unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Handling unit maximum storage temperature
Element.Description: The maximum dimensions of the handling unit: (1) Handling unit maximum storage temperature: The upper margin of the recommended storage temperature range for the item. (2) Handling unit maximum storage humidity: The upper margin of the recommended storage humidity range for the item.

Attribute.Name: Unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Call for Tenders line reference
Element.Description: Reference to a Line on a Call For Tenders document.

Element.Name: Requested deliverable identifier
Element.Description: Identifier for a requested deliverable.
